question:
The southern hemisphere of the earth has more water than land. What is / are the implications of this?
1. The atmospheric pressure is generally high at south pole
2. More doldrums are produced near south pole
3. Less westerlies blow in southern hemisphere
Choose the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: The southern hemisphere of the earth has more water than land. Because of this the atmospheric pressure is generally high at south pole. More doledrums in northern region because of the more land.
